abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Social and Fiscal
            National Identification Program (SINTyS) in Argentina was
            highly satisfactory, with a likely sustainability,
            substantial institutional development impact, and
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and Borrower.
            Lessons learned include:  SINTyS built on earlier successes
            in cross-checking information contained in assorted
            government databases by generalizing data exchanges across
            levels of government in a sustainable manner; the Project
            was successful in obtaining working agreements and
            cooperation among entities generally unaccustomed to working
            together at technical levels; and in an unclear, exploratory
            situation, it is useful to start small, focusing first on
            demonstrating early wins, establishing the credibility of
            the overall program, and preparing the groundwork for later,
            more substantial investments.
